texts.orig: UPDATE:   The
texts.text: UPDATE:   The

texts.label: code
texts.orig: chromium-vaapi
texts.text: chromium-vaapi

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: package is now
texts.text: package is now

texts.label: code
texts.orig: chromium-freeworld
texts.text: chromium-freeworld

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: . This post was updated on 2019-11-06 to include the change. See the end of the post for the update steps.
texts.text: . This post was updated on 2019-11-06 to include the change. See the end of the post for the update steps.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: If you use a web browser to watch videos on a laptop, you've probably noticed that some videos play without much impact on the battery. Other videos cause the fans to spin wildly and your battery life plummets.
texts.text: If you use a web browser to watch videos on a laptop, you've probably noticed that some videos play without much impact on the battery. Other videos cause the fans to spin wildly and your battery life plummets.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Intel designed a specification called  VA API , often called  VAAPI  (without the space), and it offers up device drivers to applications running on your system. It provides a pathway for those applications to access certain parts of the graphics processing hardware directly. This increases performance, lowers CPU usage, and increases battery life.
texts.text: Intel designed a specification called  VA API , often called  VAAPI  (without the space), and it offers up device drivers to applications running on your system. It provides a pathway for those applications to access certain parts of the graphics processing hardware directly. This increases performance, lowers CPU usage, and increases battery life.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: In this post, you will learn how to get VAAPI working on your Fedora 30 system and how to use it along with a Chromium build that has VAAPI patches already included. There are some DRM-related workarounds as well toward the end.
texts.text: In this post, you will learn how to get VAAPI working on your Fedora 30 system and how to use it along with a Chromium build that has VAAPI patches already included. There are some DRM-related workarounds as well toward the end.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Note: Keep in mind that some videos are in formats that are difficult to accelerate with a GPU and some applications support acceleration with some formats but not others. You may find that your favorite site still uses the same amount of CPU as it did before you completed this guide.  😢
texts.text: Note: Keep in mind that some videos are in formats that are difficult to accelerate with a GPU and some applications support acceleration with some formats but not others. You may find that your favorite site still uses the same amount of CPU as it did before you completed this guide.  😢

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Getting started with VAAPI
texts.text: Getting started with VAAPI

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: You will need a few packages before you get started, and some of these depend on the type of GPU that is present in your system. In my case, I'm on a 4th generation Lenovo X1 Carbon, and it has an Skylake GPU:
texts.text: You will need a few packages before you get started, and some of these depend on the type of GPU that is present in your system. In my case, I'm on a 4th generation Lenovo X1 Carbon, and it has an Skylake GPU:

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
$ lspci | grep VGA
00:02.0 VGA compatible controller: Intel Corporation Skylake GT2 [HD Graphics 520] (rev 07)
texts.text:
$ lspci | grep VGA
00:02.0 VGA compatible controller: Intel Corporation Skylake GT2 [HD Graphics 520] (rev 07)

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Fedora 30 has quite a few VAAPI packages available:
texts.text: Fedora 30 has quite a few VAAPI packages available:

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
$ sudo dnf list all | grep libva | awk '{print $1}'
libva.x86_64
libva-intel-driver.x86_64
libva-intel-hybrid-driver.x86_64
libva-utils.x86_64
libva-vdpau-driver.x86_64
libva.i686
libva-devel.i686
libva-devel.x86_64
libva-intel-driver.i686
libva-intel-hybrid-driver.i686
libva-vdpau-driver.i686
texts.text:
$ sudo dnf list all | grep libva | awk '{print $1}'
libva.x86_64
libva-intel-driver.x86_64
libva-intel-hybrid-driver.x86_64
libva-utils.x86_64
libva-vdpau-driver.x86_64
libva.i686
libva-devel.i686
libva-devel.x86_64
libva-intel-driver.i686
libva-intel-hybrid-driver.i686
libva-vdpau-driver.i686

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: My Intel GPU requires these packages:
texts.text: My Intel GPU requires these packages:

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
$ sudo dnf install libva libva-intel-driver \
    libva-vdpau-driver \
    libva-utils
texts.text:
$ sudo dnf install libva libva-intel-driver \
    libva-vdpau-driver \
    libva-utils

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: At this point, you should be able to run
texts.text: At this point, you should be able to run

texts.label: code
texts.orig: vainfo
texts.text: vainfo

texts.orig: to ensure that everything is working:
texts.text: to ensure that everything is working:

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: If you run into a problem like this one, try installing the
texts.text: If you run into a problem like this one, try installing the

texts.label: code
texts.orig: libva-intel-hybrid-driver
texts.text: libva-intel-hybrid-driver

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
$ vainfo
libva info: VA-API version 1.4.1
libva info: va_getDriverName() returns 0
libva info: Trying to open /usr/lib64/dri/i965_drv_video.so
libva info: va_openDriver() returns -1
vaInitialize failed with error code -1 (unknown libva error),exit
texts.text:
$ vainfo

libva info: va_getDriverName() returns 0
libva info: Trying to open /usr/lib64/dri/i965_drv_video.so
libva info: va_openDriver() returns -1
vaInitialize failed with error code -1 (unknown libva error),exit

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Installing Chromium with VAAPI support
texts.text: Installing Chromium with VAAPI support

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Now that we have a pathway for applications to talk to our GPU, we can install Chromium with VAAPI support:
texts.text: Now that we have a pathway for applications to talk to our GPU, we can install Chromium with VAAPI support:

texts.label: code
texts.orig: $ sudo dnf -y install chromium-freeworld
texts.text: $ sudo dnf -y install chromium-freeworld

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Run
texts.text: Run

texts.label: code
texts.orig: chromium-freeworld
texts.text: chromium-freeworld

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: to ensure Chromium starts properly. Visit chrome://flags  in the Chromium browser and search for
texts.text: to ensure Chromium starts properly. Visit chrome://flags  in the Chromium browser and search for

texts.label: code
texts.orig: ignore-gpu-blacklist
texts.text: ignore-gpu-blacklist

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: . Choose  Enabled  in the dropdown and press  Relaunch Now  in the bottom right corner.
texts.text: . Choose  Enabled  in the dropdown and press  Relaunch Now  in the bottom right corner.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: After the relaunch, check some common video sites, like  YouTube  or DailyMotion . The CPU usage may be a bit lower on these, but you can lower it further by installing the  h264ify  extension. It forces some sites to provide h264 video rather than other CPU hungry formats.
texts.text: After the relaunch, check some common video sites, like  YouTube  or DailyMotion . The CPU usage may be a bit lower on these, but you can lower it further by installing the  h264ify  extension. It forces some sites to provide h264 video rather than other CPU hungry formats.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Dealing with DRM
texts.text: Dealing with DRM

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: The only remaining problem is DRM. Some sites, like Netflix or YouTube TV, require that the browser can handle DRM content. The
texts.text: The only remaining problem is DRM. Some sites, like Netflix or YouTube TV, require that the browser can handle DRM content. The

texts.label: code
texts.orig: Widevine
texts.text: Widevine

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: DRM module is required for some of these sites, but it is automatically bundled with Chrome. The regular Chrome (not Chromium) package contains the module at:
texts.text: DRM module is required for some of these sites, but it is automatically bundled with Chrome. The regular Chrome (not Chromium) package contains the module at:

texts.label: code
texts.orig: /opt/google/chrome/libwidevinecdm.so
texts.text: /opt/google/chrome/libwidevinecdm.so

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: First, ensure Chromium is not running. Then copy that module over to Chromium's directory:
texts.text: First, ensure Chromium is not running. Then copy that module over to Chromium's directory:

texts.label: code
texts.orig: sudo cp /opt/google/chrome/libwidevinecdm.so /usr/lib64/chromium-freeworld/
texts.text: sudo cp /opt/google/chrome/libwidevinecdm.so /usr/lib64/chromium-freeworld/

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Start
texts.text: Start

texts.label: code
texts.orig: chromium-freeworld
texts.text: chromium-freeworld

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: one more time and try out some DRM-protected sites like Netflix and they should be working properly.
texts.text: one more time and try out some DRM-protected sites like Netflix and they should be working properly.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: As I mentioned at the start of the guide, some applications support acceleration with certain video formats and not others, so your results may vary.
texts.text: As I mentioned at the start of the guide, some applications support acceleration with certain video formats and not others, so your results may vary.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: New package: chromium-freeworld
texts.text: New package: chromium-freeworld

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: When this post was first written, the chromium package was called
texts.text: When this post was first written, the chromium package was called

texts.label: code
texts.orig: chromium-vaapi
texts.text: chromium-vaapi

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: . It now
texts.text: . It now

texts.label: code
texts.orig: chromium-freeworld
texts.text: chromium-freeworld

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: . The upgrade is seamless since the new package obsoletes the old one, but you need one extra step to bring over the DRM module to the new chromium library directory:
texts.text: . The upgrade is seamless since the new package obsoletes the old one, but you need one extra step to bring over the DRM module to the new chromium library directory:

texts.label: code
texts.orig: sudo cp /usr/lib64/chromium-vaapi/libwidevinecdm.so /usr/lib64/chromium-freeworld
texts.text: sudo cp /usr/lib64/chromium-vaapi/libwidevinecdm.so /usr/lib64/chromium-freeworld

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Restart
texts.text: Restart

texts.label: code
texts.orig: chromium-freeworld
texts.text: chromium-freeworld

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: and you're good to go again.
texts.text: and you're good to go again.
